paper_abstract: In many-to-many group secure communications, group members may broadcast or receive messages during any session. A fast session key distribution scheme is desirable for handling highly changeable message flows among group members. In this paper, we propose a group keying scheme using tree structures for many-to-many group secure communications. The key storage and computational complexity of the proposed scheme are acceptable and practical for real-life applications. Moreover, once keys are distributed, group members will be able to freely communicate with any member in security with no need of a group controller.
paper_title: A tree-based scheme for security of many-to-many communications
